newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates close slightly up on NCD issue.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates close slightly up on NCD issue.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates closed slightly higher on Wednesday following the central bank's issue of T$5 billion negotiable certificates of deposit to mop up excess money, dealers said.

The overnight interbank rate ended at 6.767 percent against Tuesday's 6.763 close -- still well outside the central bank's 5.0-5.5 percent target zone -- with commercial paper at 7.00 percent against 6.75-7.00.
Dealers interpreted the central bank's NCD issue as an effort to tighten liquidity to slow down the stock market's recent rally.
The benchmark stock index, which gained 8.43 points to finish at a six-year high of 8,255.07 on Wednesday, has risen more than 1,400 points in 1997 -- nearly 400 in March alone.
Dealers said they expected money rates to remain at current high levels due to the central bank's unwillingness to encourage more funds into the stock market.
In the bond market, the 10-year 86/4 bond yield was at 6.1550 percent against 6.1400.
